title: The Entire Internet Is Making The Same Joke After Robert Griffin III Continued Tweeting Like Nothing Happened Right After Being Fired From ESPN
text:
According to
The Athletic, ESPN fired NFL Countdown host Sam Ponder and analyst Robert Griffin III. The moves are for “financial reasons” and are similar to those of many other networks.
However, despite the bad news, RGIII continues to do what he loves: report NFL news. In his latest tweet, he gave opinions about the
Atlanta Falcons acquiring pass rusher Matthew Judon, and many online joked and showed support for the situation.
“can you break ur firing??” said one commenter.
“Bro got fired and posted this,” said another about Griffin
“Bro, you are undervalued at ESPN. Can’t wait to see unfettered and independent RGIII or see you go to Fox,” said another in support.
“One of the few times I’ll ever say this- but espn screwed up. Don’t know the behind the scenes but bright things ahead!” added a fourth.

Of course, Griffin has been with ESPN since 2021 and had many fans.
Robert Griffin III Will Likely Find A New Job Soon
Griffin turned a successful yet short NFL playing stint due to injuries into an amazing career as an NFL and college football analyst.
That’s why it was so surprising that he was let go from ESPN with two whole years left on his contract. He was also one of the most beloved by the public throughout the station.
However, he is expected to find a new network soon to continue informing his nearly three million followers across both Instagram and X.
